description: Returns details about an anomaly that you specify using its ID.

nested_items.name: ProactiveAnomaly
nested_items.description: A ProactiveAnomaly object that represents the requested anomaly.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The ID of a proactive anomaly.

nested_items.name: Severity
nested_items.description: The severity of the anomaly. The severity of anomalies that generate an insight determine that insight's severity. For more information, see Understanding insight severities in the Amazon DevOps Guru User Guide.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of a proactive anomaly.

nested_items.name: UpdateTime
nested_items.description: The time of the anomaly's most recent update.

nested_items.name: AnomalyTimeRange
nested_items.description: A time range that specifies when the observed unusual behavior in an anomaly started and ended. This is different from AnomalyReportedTimeRange, which specifies the time range when DevOps Guru opens and then closes an anomaly.

nested_items.name: StartTime
nested_items.description: The time when the anomalous behavior started.

nested_items.name: EndTime
nested_items.description: The time when the anomalous behavior ended.

nested_items.name: AnomalyReportedTimeRange
nested_items.description: An AnomalyReportedTimeRange object that specifies the time range between when the anomaly is opened and the time when it is closed.

nested_items.name: OpenTime
nested_items.description: The time when an anomaly is opened.

nested_items.name: CloseTime
nested_items.description: The time when an anomaly is closed.

nested_items.name: PredictionTimeRange
nested_items.description: The time range during which anomalous behavior in a proactive anomaly or an insight is expected to occur.

nested_items.name: StartTime
nested_items.description: The time range during which a metric limit is expected to be exceeded. This applies to proactive insights only.

nested_items.name: EndTime
nested_items.description: The time when the behavior in a proactive insight is expected to end.

nested_items.name: SourceDetails
nested_items.description: Details about the source of the analyzed operational data that triggered the anomaly. The one supported source is Amazon CloudWatch metrics.

nested_items.name: CloudWatchMetrics
nested_items.description: An array of CloudWatchMetricsDetail objects that contain information about analyzed CloudWatch metrics that show anomalous behavior.

nested_items.name: MetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the CloudWatch metric.

nested_items.name: Namespace
nested_items.description: The namespace of the CloudWatch metric. A namespace is a container for CloudWatch metrics.

nested_items.name: Dimensions
nested_items.description: An array of CloudWatch dimensions associated with.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the CloudWatch dimension.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the CloudWatch dimension.

nested_items.name: Stat
nested_items.description: The type of statistic associated with the CloudWatch metric. For more information, see Statistics in the Amazon CloudWatch User Guide.

nested_items.name: Unit
nested_items.description: The unit of measure used for the CloudWatch metric. For example, Bytes, Seconds, Count, and Percent.

nested_items.name: Period
nested_items.description: The length of time associated with the CloudWatch metric in number of seconds.

nested_items.name: MetricDataSummary
nested_items.description: This object returns anomaly metric data.

nested_items.name: TimestampMetricValuePairList
nested_items.description: This is a list of Amazon CloudWatch metric values at given timestamp.

nested_items.name: Timestamp
nested_items.description: A Timestamp that specifies the time the event occurred.

nested_items.name: MetricValue
nested_items.description: Value of the anomalous metric data point at respective Timestamp.

nested_items.name: StatusCode
nested_items.description: This is an enum of the status showing whether the metric value pair list has partial or complete data, or if there was an error.

nested_items.name: PerformanceInsightsMetrics
nested_items.description: An array of PerformanceInsightsMetricsDetail objects that contain information about analyzed Performance Insights metrics that show anomalous behavior.
To learn more about Performance Insights and Amazon Aurora DB instances, go to the Amazon Aurora User Guide.
To learn more about Performance Insights and Amazon RDS DB instances, go to the Amazon RDS User Guide.

nested_items.name: AssociatedInsightId
nested_items.description: The ID of the insight that contains this anomaly. An insight is composed of related anomalies.

nested_items.name: ResourceCollection
nested_items.description: A collection of Amazon Web Services resources supported by DevOps Guru. The two types of Amazon Web Services resource collections supported are Amazon Web Services CloudFormation stacks and Amazon Web Services resources that contain the same Amazon Web Services tag. DevOps Guru can be configured to analyze the Amazon Web Services resources that are defined in the stacks or that are tagged using the same tag key. You can specify up to 500 Amazon Web Services CloudFormation stacks.

nested_items.name: CloudFormation
nested_items.description: An array of the names of Amazon Web Services CloudFormation stacks. The stacks define Amazon Web Services resources that DevOps Guru analyzes. You can specify up to 500 Amazon Web Services CloudFormation stacks.

nested_items.name: StackNames
nested_items.description: An array of CloudFormation stack names.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services tags that are used by resources in the resource collection.

nested_items.type: for example, CostCenter, Environment, Project, or Secret
nested_items.description: A tag key (for example, CostCenter, Environment, Project, or Secret). Tag keys are case-sensitive.

nested_items.type: for example, 111122223333, Production, or a team name
nested_items.description: An optional field known as a tag value (for example, 111122223333, Production, or a team name). Omitting the tag value is the same as using an empty string. Like tag keys, tag values are case-sensitive.

nested_items.name: Limit
nested_items.description: A threshold that was exceeded by behavior in analyzed resources. Exceeding this threshold is related to the anomalous behavior that generated this anomaly.

nested_items.name: SourceMetadata
nested_items.description: The metadata for the anomaly.

nested_items.name: Source
nested_items.description: The source of the anomaly.

nested_items.name: SourceResourceName
nested_items.description: The name of the anomaly's resource.

nested_items.name: SourceResourceType
nested_items.description: The anomaly's resource type.

nested_items.name: AnomalyResources
nested_items.description: Information about a resource in which DevOps Guru detected anomalous behavior.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon Web Services resource.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of the Amazon Web Services resource.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description of the proactive anomaly.

nested_items.name: ReactiveAnomaly
nested_items.description: A ReactiveAnomaly object that represents the requested anomaly.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The ID of the reactive anomaly.

nested_items.name: Severity
nested_items.description: The severity of the anomaly. The severity of anomalies that generate an insight determine that insight's severity. For more information, see Understanding insight severities in the Amazon DevOps Guru User Guide.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the anomaly.

nested_items.name: AnomalyTimeRange
nested_items.description: A time range that specifies when the observed unusual behavior in an anomaly started and ended. This is different from AnomalyReportedTimeRange, which specifies the time range when DevOps Guru opens and then closes an anomaly.

nested_items.name: StartTime
nested_items.description: The time when the anomalous behavior started.

nested_items.name: EndTime
nested_items.description: The time when the anomalous behavior ended.

nested_items.name: AnomalyReportedTimeRange
nested_items.description: An AnomalyReportedTimeRange object that specifies the time range between when the anomaly is opened and the time when it is closed.

nested_items.name: OpenTime
nested_items.description: The time when an anomaly is opened.

nested_items.name: CloseTime
nested_items.description: The time when an anomaly is closed.

nested_items.name: SourceDetails
nested_items.description: Details about the source of the analyzed operational data that triggered the anomaly. The one supported source is Amazon CloudWatch metrics.

nested_items.name: CloudWatchMetrics
nested_items.description: An array of CloudWatchMetricsDetail objects that contain information about analyzed CloudWatch metrics that show anomalous behavior.

nested_items.name: MetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the CloudWatch metric.

nested_items.name: Namespace
nested_items.description: The namespace of the CloudWatch metric. A namespace is a container for CloudWatch metrics.

nested_items.name: Dimensions
nested_items.description: An array of CloudWatch dimensions associated with.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the CloudWatch dimension.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the CloudWatch dimension.

nested_items.name: Stat
nested_items.description: The type of statistic associated with the CloudWatch metric. For more information, see Statistics in the Amazon CloudWatch User Guide.

nested_items.name: Unit
nested_items.description: The unit of measure used for the CloudWatch metric. For example, Bytes, Seconds, Count, and Percent.

nested_items.name: Period
nested_items.description: The length of time associated with the CloudWatch metric in number of seconds.

nested_items.name: MetricDataSummary
nested_items.description: This object returns anomaly metric data.

nested_items.name: TimestampMetricValuePairList
nested_items.description: This is a list of Amazon CloudWatch metric values at given timestamp.

nested_items.name: Timestamp
nested_items.description: A Timestamp that specifies the time the event occurred.

nested_items.name: MetricValue
nested_items.description: Value of the anomalous metric data point at respective Timestamp.

nested_items.name: StatusCode
nested_items.description: This is an enum of the status showing whether the metric value pair list has partial or complete data, or if there was an error.

nested_items.name: PerformanceInsightsMetrics
nested_items.description: An array of PerformanceInsightsMetricsDetail objects that contain information about analyzed Performance Insights metrics that show anomalous behavior.
To learn more about Performance Insights and Amazon Aurora DB instances, go to the Amazon Aurora User Guide.
To learn more about Performance Insights and Amazon RDS DB instances, go to the Amazon RDS User Guide.

nested_items.name: AssociatedInsightId
nested_items.description: The ID of the insight that contains this anomaly. An insight is composed of related anomalies.

nested_items.name: ResourceCollection
nested_items.description: A collection of Amazon Web Services resources supported by DevOps Guru. The two types of Amazon Web Services resource collections supported are Amazon Web Services CloudFormation stacks and Amazon Web Services resources that contain the same Amazon Web Services tag. DevOps Guru can be configured to analyze the Amazon Web Services resources that are defined in the stacks or that are tagged using the same tag key. You can specify up to 500 Amazon Web Services CloudFormation stacks.

nested_items.name: CloudFormation
nested_items.description: An array of the names of Amazon Web Services CloudFormation stacks. The stacks define Amazon Web Services resources that DevOps Guru analyzes. You can specify up to 500 Amazon Web Services CloudFormation stacks.

nested_items.name: StackNames
nested_items.description: An array of CloudFormation stack names.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services tags that are used by resources in the resource collection.

nested_items.type: for example, CostCenter, Environment, Project, or Secret
nested_items.description: A tag key (for example, CostCenter, Environment, Project, or Secret). Tag keys are case-sensitive.

nested_items.type: for example, 111122223333, Production, or a team name
nested_items.description: An optional field known as a tag value (for example, 111122223333, Production, or a team name). Omitting the tag value is the same as using an empty string. Like tag keys, tag values are case-sensitive.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of the reactive anomaly. It can be one of the following types.
CAUSAL - the anomaly can cause a new insight.
CONTEXTUAL - the anomaly contains additional information about an insight or its causal anomaly.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the reactive anomaly.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description of the reactive anomaly.

nested_items.name: CausalAnomalyId
nested_items.description: The ID of the causal anomaly that is associated with this reactive anomaly. The ID of a CAUSAL anomaly is always NULL.

nested_items.name: AnomalyResources
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services resources in which anomalous behavior was detected by DevOps Guru.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon Web Services resource.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of the Amazon Web Services resource.
